Personal statement  
Green gas transition expert with deep industry experience of Hydrogen and LNG in transport applications.  I have 
launched and grown Hydrogen and LNG businesses over the last 10 years having leadership and direct responsibility 
for sales and commercial management, project execution and operation, grant funding management and P&L 
responsibility. 
Career  
ENGIE UK – August 2017 to date 
 
UK subsidiary of ENGIE Group.  A £3bn p.a energy and services business with interests in renewable energy 
infrastructure, gas and power supply, district heating schemes and hard/soft FM services. 
 
Business Development Manager – Green Mobility 
Reporting to the divisional managing director, I lead the start-up of ENGIE’s Gas for Transport business in the UK.   
 
Develop and implementation of the business strategy, lead all aspects of the business start up including product and 
service development, sourcing, engineering, HSE, commercial policies, back office processes and resourcing. 
 
Sales responsibility for hydrogen and natural gas refuelling infrastructure projects.   Forming partnerships within the 
value chain and with local authorities and logistics companies to develop Hydrogen and gas refuelling projects.  
 
 
BOC Ltd (A member of Linde group) -   June 1994 to August 2017 
 
Market leading UK based industrial gases company with £1bn p.a turnover.  Specialising in sales of bulk cryogenic 
liquids and compressed gases, process technology and associated infrastructure/services.    
 
Market Development Manager – Clean Fuels – June 2016 to August 2017 
Reporting to the business manager Clean Fuels, I was responsible for sales & market development of the Clean Fuels 
business focussing on hydrogen mobility.   
 
Responsible for commercial & operational management of the Hydrogen mobility business including P&L 
responsibility, key supplier and service relationships and key customer relationships.  Led and achieved sales growth 
in the hydrogen refuelling station product line to systems integrators and direct customers. 
 
Management responsibility for FCHJU and Innovate UK grant funded projects including the Aberdeen Hydrogen bus 
project. 
 
Represented BOC interests in Hydrogen mobility through industry associations, UK and EU government relationships 
and partnership/collaborative relationships within the value chain. 
 
Sales Manager – Liquid Natural Gas (LNG) – August 2011 to May 2016 
Reported to the business manager LNG and responsible for the sales and market development activities of the LNG 
business in the UK.  I was responsibility for the sales and marketing plan and managing a team of business 
development managers selling to the heavy truck, marine and industrial sectors. 
 
Owned the sales and product development plan leading cross functional teams to evolve and launch new products 
and services.  Successful launch of 2 new products which directly contributed to revenue growth 
 
Created and managed a sales team, established and implemented sales & account management processes, tools 
and SFDC to achieve sales growth 
 
Direct responsibility for key customer management and in the start up phase personally secured £15m of sales 
contracts 
 
  
Business Development Manager (Innovation) – February 2010 to July 2011 
Reported to the head of future business and innovation.  I held responsibility for the detailed evaluation and 
development of new business or new products and services through a stage and gate process from concept to 
investment approval to market entry.   
 
Project manager for the development to launch of the LNG business.  I led a cross functional team to construct the 
enabling functions and market offer.   This involved working with engineering, transport, procurement and other 
business functions. 
 
Established and managed relationships with key technology providers and service delivery partners.   Formed 
agreements in the value chain to enable delivery of product and service offers. 
 
Industry Sales Specialist (Chemicals, Energy & Fuels) - August 2007 to January 2010  
Reported direct to the regional sales manager and responsible for managing a £7.5m p.a portfolio of key customers 
within the Chemicals, Energy and Fuel sectors.   
 
Secured BOC’s 1st hydrogen for transport contract with refuelling infrastructure.  This began the development of the 
Hydrogen mobility business. 
 
Drove portfolio growth and customer retention through introduction of applications technology.  Managed process 
audits and consultancy projects to identify areas of profitable growth and added value within customer operations. 
 
Working with national and international technical specialists to identify and develop opportunities for new business 
growth. I worked with the global clean energy team to initiate a project to look at natural gas as a transportation fuel 
which lead to the launch of an LNG business in the UK 
 
Business Development Manager – Universities/Research - October 2003 to August 2007 
Reported to the business manager Universities & Research.  I held responsibility for product development, sales and 
account management within this segment. 
 
Generated average £4m p.a new business through development and launch of engineering solutions and gas supply 
packages for new research facilities.  Managed the business concept through a stage and gate approvals process, 
developed the market offer, established delivery partnerships and achieved sales post launch. 
 
Secured new facilities management business at University of Cambridge and Queen Mary’s college London worth 
£2m. 
 
Customer Development Executive – Key Customers - November 1999 to October 2003 
Worked with key customer managers across multiple sectors to generate new revenue streams    
 
Focus on developing a new onsite facilities management offer.  Gained £1.5m contract to supply onsite management 
services to Imperial College London, together with opportunities at University of Cambridge and Queen Mary’s college 
London which were subsequently secured. 
 
Customer Account Executive - April 1997 to November 1999 
Responsible for managing a team of 8 back office support staff. Developed and implemented SAP commercial training 
programme for regional sales teams.   
 
Customer Service Advisor - June 1994 to April 1997 
Project manager for developing best practice framework within sales support functions.   
 
Education 
 
1994-1998 - Manchester Metropolitan University - B.A Honours – Business Studies 
 
Interests 
 
Leadership experience gained as the chairman of the board of trustees for a local activity centre offering water and 
land-based sports. I led the development of a commercial policy, recruitment of the centre manager, development of 
a business strategy and sales plan. I have also held a director post on the board of a local arts development 
organisation. 
 
In my spare time I have worked with the University of Coventry London campus in providing mentorship and project 
support to groups of MBA students on an oil and gas programme. Several students I have mentored have achieved 
the highest scores in their year.
